conclusion: Use properties of light refraction and Snell's law to solve the problem.
Identify given values: Radius R, Distance from D to AC is sqrt(3)/2 R, Distance DE is sqrt(2) R.
Since DE = sqrt(2) R, distance from D to center O is OE = R.
Substitute values: n1/n2 = sqrt(2) R/R = sqrt(2).
Since n1 is the refractive index, n1 = sqrt(2).
Speed of light in vacuum c = 3 x 10^8.
Use speed of light formula: c = n1 x v, solve for v: v = c/n1 = 3 x 10^8/sqrt(2).
Since speed of light in medium is same as in vacuum, 3 x 10^8/sqrt(2) = n2 x 3 x 10^8.
Calculate final refractive index: n2 = 3 x 10^8/sqrt(2).
